Title: Faure Pelleas Honegger 2 Philadelphia Munch Mar 1963 Live
Description: Charles Munch's two-week guest conducting stint with Philadelphia in March of 1963 yielded commercial recordings on Columbia of Faure's Pelleas et Melisande, Ravel's Valses Nobles et Sentimentales, and Berlioz's Damnation of Faust (MS6523), all recorded in a single day at the now-demolished Philadelphia Athletic Club on N. Broad St.  (The Ravel and Berlioz can be found buried on a couple of Sony Essential Classics issues, but I've never been able to find the Faure or a digital version of MS6523.)  The real treat here to my mind is the Honegger, which was dedicated to Munch (a tireless champion of his compositions), which Philadelphia never commercially recorded under any conductor.
